iati-activity.title: Health Sector Support
iati-activity.description: The project aims to i) increase institutional capacity to plan, manage and finance the health sector ii) develop accessible, affordable, quality, basic curative and preventative health services for the population, especially women and the poor, iii) increase utilisation of health services, especially by women and the poor, iv) control and mitigate the effects of infectious disease epidemics and of malutrition, with emphasis on the poor.

iati-activity.title: Cambodia Social Marketing of Reproductive Health Commodities
iati-activity.description: Increased consistent and correct use of high quality products and services (including socially marketed products and services) for A) HIV and STI prevention, B) improved sexual and reproductive health, and C) child survival (pending USAID funds becoming available) among priority populations, especially people engaging in high risk behaviours (for HIV and STI prevention) and the poor.

iati-activity.title: Rehabilitation of People with Physical Disabilities CSCF388
iati-activity.description: The CSPO is a regional resource whose purpose is to address a shortfall in regional human resources capacity in Prosthetist-Orthotists, in order to ensure that disabled people in the region can gain access to appropriate rehabilitation services which will in turn enable them to increase their self-sufficiency and reduce poverty.

contact-info.mailing-address: Public Enquiry Point, Abercrombie House, Eaglesham Road, East Kilbride, Glasgow G75 8EA

iati-activity.related-activity: NOTFORPROFITORG and P0118 for Rehabilitation of People with Physical Disabilities CSCF388

Accountable Grant CSCF0388: A STRATEGIC APPROACH TO ENSURING SUSTAINABILITY OF THE CAMBODIAN SCHOOL OF PROSTHETICS & ORTHOTICS (CSPO) AS A REGIONAL FOCUS FOR THE APPROPRIATE REHABILITATION OF PEOPLE WITH PHYSICAL DISABILITY
